answers.answer: Although both are related to red blood cells they don't appear to be connected. Diabetes type 2 is associated with excess sugar binding to RBC's where PRV is associated with excess RBC's produced by an abnormality of the bone marrow. Neither has a cure but both can be treated to prevent further escalation. If left untreated and ignored the possibility of a stroke or heart attack can be imagined, among other health issues. Hope you're in full dialog with your attending physician/s on the "what to do's". Good luck
